title: Every region wants a Wukong rework, but China doesn't, so no rework.
body:
Almost any Wukong you ask wants a rework on him, not even neccesarilly a full rework, although he has a lot of potential with his story and skins, but whatever. Only a mini rework would be amazing to make him more skillful and have some sort of a way to actually deal with top lane match ups. Right now (or for the last 2-3 years) he loses like 90% of top lane match ups, and in the jungle you can just invade him all day long, because he's gonna be low hp almost always. That's why he was played mid lane and got a first debut in lcs since season 4. LOL and immediately nerfed 3 times in a row.
He has so much potential for a rework and amazing skins, but he's being left in the gutter again after being in it for 4 years.

That doesn't mean "he's not getting a rework". 

The difference between Wukong and, say, Urgot or Galio or Yorick is that Wukong has a fairly high playrate and thus is someone people _do_ enjoy playing. Riot's reworks are often aimed at A.) Champs who have fallen to the wayside or B.) Champs who have extremely outdated kits. It's why Yorick got a rework before pantheon: Despite being younger than Pantheon, less people played Yorick and he was in an overall worse spot. 

Wukong does need a rework. He's still getting one. But he also has a pretty high playrate which means that you have to be more careful about reworking him. Also to address the incoming "bUt wHuT aBouT aAtrOx!?" comment: Aatrox only recently became meta after his rework was slated almost a year in advance. Bad timing, not that his design was in a good spot. (Argue about the new one as you wish).

More than Mundo, yes. Mundo isn't nearly as problematic as any of those champions.

Mundo is rightfully really high on Riots priority list.
I mean, come on, he has probably one of the most outdated kits in the entire game.

His passive is **literally** just an increased stat: I have more health regen than other guys.... wow.
His W, E, and R are all passive effects (glorified sunfire cape, more damage, more health regen) which he can activate on demand.
He needs an update badly and I am glad that Riot confirmed that he is high on the priority list. Most likely will get his rework next year, alongside Mordekaiser.
His passive is a percentage. It scales with his actual health unlike normal base regen. The fact that he has extremely high health regen is a significant part of his play pattern as well.
Hes still getting a rework, just more time and thought needs to be put into it and the list of champions that also need a rework badly still exists.

He's probably popular there more so because he's based on Sun Wukong from Journey to the West which was a 16th century Chinese novel deeply rooted in Chinese philosophy and religion. He's basically THE Chinese champion. So I'd imagine just due to the historical context of the champion himself he will continue to be popular in that region regardless of any future rework. There have even been two big budget Chinese cinema films within the last decade titled "The Monkey King" & "The Monkey King 2" which, you guessed it, are about Sun Wukong and the tales from Journey to the West, his champion name in China is even listed and appears in game as "Sun Wukong". The Infernal Wukong skin is also a direct reference to his story in Journey to the West when he was placed in a cauldron for being a bad monkey. He then learned to control his rage and broke free from the cauldron in a fiery blaze.
Which requires research to see if thats the case, and if so, what can be done to improve upon it.

I'd say just rework him anyway, as I don't see that killing his popularity there. He also doesn't get played in pro play to my knowledge so I'm sure it's just the fact that he is The Monkey King as to why he is popular. I too would be interested in the actual reasoning though as that is just my best educated guess. Perhaps they could do one of those many in client surveys they love so much to find out~ Besides we know Riot doesn't care about how popular a champion or role is unless it comes to selling skins. I mean Riot murdered marksmen and their popularity (number of people queueing for bot lane dropped significantly because of it), so being popular does not protect a champion or group of champions from a rework. He also isn't the worst champion in the game (I personally think he's fine other than his passive).
Again, hes still getting a rework.
